com.yantra.api.vas

Interface getWorkOrderAppointmentOptions

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    com.yantra.api.VASApi, YIFApi

    public interface getWorkOrderAppointmentOptions

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document getWorkOrderAppointmentOptions(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      The getWorkOrderAppointmentOptions API retrieves any available options for a work order.

    • Method Detail

      • getWorkOrderAppointmentOptions

        org.w3c.dom.Document getWorkOrderAppointmentOptions(YFSEnvironment env,
                                                    org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                                             throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                                                    java.rmi.RemoteException

        The getWorkOrderAppointmentOptions API retrieves any available options for a work order.

        The scheduling process determines the node to source work order from. It also determines the date on which the work order or order line can be sourced from a given node / resource pool. The getWorkOrderAppointmentOptions API retrieves schedules based on the possible combinations of nodes and dates that can be used to source an order. From the possible combinations, the system determines the best schedule based on various constraints.

        For provided service and delivery service lines, the time slots that determine when a provided service can be performed or a delivery can be made are returned. These time slots belong to only one time zone and are returned across the resource pools that satisfy the input criteria based on the sourcing rule configuration. Slots which cannot be used for appointment planning will not be used for finding the possible options.
        When looking up inventory availability, supplies and demands of the Item/Node combinations that are being marked as having incorrect inventory picture will not be considered. This will only matter for non-reserved quantities on the order lines. For any reserved quantities, inventory availability will be determined irrespective of incorrect inventory picture.

        The on-hand safety factor will be excluded from on-hand inventory availability based on the following logic when the ApplyOnhandSafetyFactor flag on the scheduling rule is set to Y.

        • If OnhandSafetyFactorQuantity or OnhandSafetyFactorPercentage is configured for the item, it will be excluded from the current availability of the item at the node with a node type that has ApplyOnhandSafetyFactor = Y for each requested node, tag, segment type and segment combination. (Note: On-hand safety factor will only be applied to supplies with supply type that has a corresponding record in the YFS_INV_AVAIL_SAFETY_FACTOR table).
        • Otherwise if on-hand supply type has a safety factor percentage configured, it will be excluded from the supplies with that supply type for the item at the node with node type that has ApplyOnhandSafetyFactor = Y for each requested node, tag, segment type and segment combination.

        The future safety factor will be excluded from future inventory availability based on the following logic when the ApplyFutureSafetyFactor flag on the scheduling rule is set to Y.

        • If FutureSafetyFactorPercentage is configured for the item, it will be excluded from the current availability of the item at the node with a node type that has ApplyFutureSafetyFactor = Y for each requested node, tag, segment type and segment combination. (Note: Future safety factor will only be applied to supplies with supply type that has a corresponding record in the YFS_INV_AVAIL_SAFETY_FACTOR table).
        • Otherwise if future supply type has a safety factor percentage configured, it will be excluded from the supplies with that supply type for the item at the node with node type that has ApplyFutureSafetyFactor = Y for each requested node, tag, segment type and segment combination.

        The additional required capacity for the work order will be computed based on the additional capacity for region and service type configuration. The region that the ship to address falls under and the service type of the service items will be used. Additional required capacity of each delivery service item will be treated as part of its fixed capacity. If there are more than one delivery service items in the work order, the maximum fixed capacity across the delivery service items in the work order will be used as the fixed required capacity of the work order.

        Capacity can be requested in weight and volume dimensions as well. But these requested capacities will be considered only if the resource pool maintains capacity in those dimensions. If capacity is not requested in weight and volume dimensions, those capacities are calculated based on the weight and volume of the product items to which the service items are associated.

        If a customer exists in the order, the slots in PromiseServiceLine will be returned based upon the customer's slot preference configuration unless CheckCapacity is passed as N.

        For more information on sourcing refer to ScheduleOrder api.

        • If customer's slot preference type is HARD, only preferred slots will be returned.
        • If customer's slot preference type is SOFT, all available slots will be returned. Preferred slots will have Preferred=Y. Other slots will have Preferred=N.
        • If customer's slot preference type is NONE, all available slots will be returned with Preferred=N.

        The capacity required will be affected by the answer set (belonging to the work order's order) that is associated with the ServiceLocationAddressKey, if applicable .

        If MinShipByDate is specified on the order line with a time sensitive item, available supply with ShipByDate earlier than the MinShipByDate will not be considered in the availability of the item.

        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD Error XML Error DTD

        Events Raised: None

        Audits: None

        Pre-conditions: None

        Post-conditions: None

        Output Template Support: Yes

        Database Extensibility Support: No

        Configuration Required for Backward Compatability: No

        Additional Information: See getResourcePoolCapacity API for more details on capacity availability.

        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
        inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.

        Returns:
        An XML document that contains the possible schedules. For details on the output, refer to the associated output files.
        Throws:
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException - Exception containing error codes in the standard error files.
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Java's default remote exception handler.
